docs.title: Home
docs.text:
DeltaWorlds SDK – Behavioral Documentation

This site documents the observable behavior of the DeltaWorlds / ActiveWorlds-style SDK as derived from static analysis, decompilation, and runtime reasoning.

It is a behavioral specification, not an SDK implementation.

Purpose

This documentation defines a single source of truth for SDK behavior so that compatible clients, viewers, and tooling can be implemented correctly.

Compatibility is defined by behavior, not by internal structure.

Core Concepts

Thread-Local Runtime Each thread owns its own SDK context. The SDK is not reentrant.

Explicit Event Pump The SDK makes no forward progress unless aw_wait is called.

Server Authority The server is the single source of truth. Client calls stage intent only.

Minimal Correct Client Flow

  1. aw_init
  2. Configure callbacks and events
  3. aw_login
  4. aw_enter or aw_join
  5. Main loop:
  6. aw_wait
  7. process callbacks and events
  8. aw_exit
  9. aw_term

Getting the Official SDK

The official SDK is available from:

https://www.deltaworlds.com/

This project does not redistribute SDK binaries or headers.

docs.title: Signature
docs.text: bool aw_has_world_right(int world_id, int right_id);

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Checks whether the current session has a specific right within a given world.

docs.title: Preconditions
docs.text:
• aw_init must have been called
  • SDK must be initialized
  • A valid session/connection handle must exist

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• Verifies SDK initialized flag (TLS +0x7E0)
  • Verifies presence of active session/connection handle (TLS +0x7E4)
  • Delegates world-right evaluation to an internal handler

docs.title: State Effects
docs.text:
• None
  • Pure permission query

docs.title: Return Values
docs.text:
• 1 if the specified world right is granted
  • 0 otherwise or if preconditions are not met

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text:
• No networking
  • No memory allocation

docs.title: Call Order Role
docs.text:
• World authority / permission query
  • Used to gate world-scoped operations

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Requires an active world/session context

docs.title: Signature
docs.text: bool aw_has_world_right_all(int right_id);

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Checks whether the current session has a specific right across all worlds.

docs.title: Preconditions
docs.text:
• aw_init must have been called
  • SDK must be initialized
  • A valid session/connection handle must exist

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• Verifies SDK initialized flag (TLS +0x7E0)
  • Verifies presence of active session/connection handle (TLS +0x7E4)
  • Delegates global world-right evaluation to an internal handler

docs.title: State Effects
docs.text:
• None
  • Pure permission query

docs.title: Return Values
docs.text:
• 1 if the specified right is granted for all worlds
  • 0 otherwise or if preconditions are not met

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text:
• No networking
  • No memory allocation

docs.title: Call Order Role
docs.text:
• Global world authority query
  • Used to verify elevated or administrative permissions

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Requires an active session context

docs.title: Signature
docs.text: int aw_init(int mode);

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: • mode: integer value in range 0x41–0x65 (65–101)

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text:
• Returns 0 on success
  • Returns 0x1C6 on invalid parameter

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• Calls aw_term to clear any previous SDK state
  • Initializes per-thread SDK context (TLS)
  • Resets internal state blocks
  • Seeds random number generation using time, PID, and rand
  • Stores SDK mode/version
  • Sets initialized flag

docs.title: State Effects
docs.text:
• Thread-local SDK context is created or reset
  • Initialization timestamp recorded
  • Session/world state cleared

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text:
• No networking
  • No file I/O
  • No thread creation

docs.title: Call Order
docs.text:
• Must be called before any other SDK function
  • Safe only once per thread unless aw_term is called

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• SDK uses TLS for all internal state
  • Mode value may influence protocol or feature flags

docs.title: Signature
docs.text: void aw_world_attribute_get(uint attribute, uint type, char value);

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Retrieves the value of a world attribute for the active world/session.

docs.title: Preconditions
docs.text:
• aw_init must have been called
  • SDK must be initialized
  • A valid session/connection handle must exist
  • Caller must provide a writable buffer for value

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• Verifies SDK initialized flag (TLS +0x7E0)
  • Verifies presence of active session/connection handle (TLS +0x7E4)
  • Checks internal string encoding mode (TLS +0x7E8)
  • If Unicode mode:
  • Passes output buffer directly to internal handler
  • If non-Unicode mode:
  • Retrieves value into an internal wide-character buffer
  • Converts the result into the caller-provided ANSI buffer
  • Writes attribute type to the provided type pointer

docs.title: State Effects
docs.text:
• None
  • Pure query against world state

docs.title: Return Values
docs.text:
• None (void)
  • Failure results in no modification of output buffers

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text:
• No networking initiated at this level
  • Temporary stack buffer usage for string conversion

docs.title: Call Order Role
docs.text:
• World data query function
  • Used to inspect world metadata and configuration

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Caller is responsible for buffer size
  • Attribute identifiers are protocol-defined

docs.title: Signature
docs.text: int aw_world_attribute_set(uint attribute, const char *value);

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Sets a world attribute if it is not already defined.

docs.title: Preconditions
docs.text:
• aw_init must have been called
  • SDK must be initialized
  • A valid session/connection handle must exist
  • Caller must have appropriate world permissions

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• Verifies SDK initialized flag (TLS +0x7E0)
  • Verifies presence of active session/connection handle (TLS +0x7E4)
  • Validates value length does not exceed 255 bytes
  • Checks internal string encoding mode (TLS +0x7E8)
  • Converts value to internal Unicode representation if required
  • Delegates attribute assignment to internal property setter
  • Attribute is only set if not already defined

docs.title: State Effects
docs.text:
• May modify world attribute state on the server
  • No local TLS modification observed

docs.title: Return Values
docs.text:
• 0 on success
  • 0x1BC if SDK is not initialized
  • 0x1BD if no session/connection handle is present
  • 0x1C2 if value exceeds maximum length
  • Other error codes as defined by internal setter

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text:
• Initiates network activity related to world configuration
  • Temporary memory allocation for string conversion

docs.title: Call Order Role
docs.text:
• World configuration function
  • Used during world setup or initialization

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Does not overwrite existing attributes
  • Attribute identifiers and semantics are protocol-defined

docs.title: Signature
docs.text: int aw_world_attributes_change(void);

docs.title: Role
docs.text: Commits or packages pending world attribute changes for transmission or application.

docs.title: Preconditions
docs.text:
• aw_init must have been called
  • SDK must be initialized
  • A valid session/connection handle must exist
  • One or more world attributes must have been staged or modified

docs.title: Behavior
docs.text:
• Verifies SDK initialized flag (TLS +0x7E0)
  • Verifies presence of active session/connection handle (TLS +0x7E4)
  • Delegates attribute change packaging to an internal configuration packager
  • Prepares modified world attributes for application or network transmission

docs.title: State Effects
docs.text:
• Flushes or commits pending world attribute changes
  • No direct TLS modification observed

docs.title: Return Values
docs.text:
• 0x1BC if SDK is not initialized
  • 0x1BD if no session/connection handle is present
  • Otherwise returns result from internal configuration packager

docs.title: Side Effects
docs.text:
• Initiates network activity related to world attribute updates
  • May trigger world attribute change events or callbacks

docs.title: Call Order Role
docs.text:
• World configuration finalization function
  • Must be called after one or more aw_world_attribute_set calls
  • Completes the world metadata update cycle

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Acts as a commit/apply step for batched world attribute changes
  • Ordering relative to aw_world_attribute_set is significant

docs.title: Ghidra Analysis Notes
docs.text: This directory contains notes specific to Ghidra analysis.

docs.title: Conventions
docs.text:
• Decompiled code is treated as evidence, not ground truth
  • Assembly listings override decompiler output if discrepancies appear
  • Offsets are recorded relative to TLS base where applicable

docs.title: Tools Used
docs.text:
• Ghidra (PE loader, decompiler, function graphs)
  • SDK headers imported as C for type accuracy

docs.title: Protocol Overview
docs.text: This section documents observed wire-level behavior derived from SDK analysis.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
• Match packet formats
  • Match message ordering
  • Match state transitions expected by the server

docs.title: Status
docs.text:
• Initial export analysis only
  • Packet formats to be documented per export

docs.title: aw_callback_set Behavior
docs.text: Reverse-engineered contract for callback registration.

docs.title: aw_event_set Behavior
docs.text: Reverse-engineered contract for event registration.

docs.title: Driver set event
docs.text:
# ClassicSdk Driver SetEvent Behavior

## Function

ClassicSdk_ClassicSdk_Driver__SetEvent(EventId, Callback)

## Purpose

Maintains the runtime mapping between SdkCore_EventId values and their

registered managed delegates. This function does NOT assign event mask bits.

## Storage

Event registrations are stored in:

Driver::__GCSTATICS + 0x78

Type: ConcurrentDictionary

## Behavior

### Callback Removal

If Callback == NULL:

- The EventId entry is removed from the dictionary using TryRemove

- The event will no longer participate in event mask generation

### Callback Registration

If Callback != NULL:

- The unmanaged function pointer is wrapped into a managed delegate

- The dictionary is updated using AddOrUpdate(EventId, Delegate)

No event mask bits are computed or modified here.

## Event Mask Relationship

SetEvent does not determine which bit corresponds to an event.

Event mask bits are derived later by:

- WorldSession.GetEventMask()

- Iterating session-owned OrderedDictionary entries

- OR-ing per-entry mask values when a corresponding EventId exists in the Driver dictionary

## Implications

- SdkCore_EventId numeric values do not map directly to mask bits

- Mask bit positions are determined by session state and registration order

- This design preserves backward compatibility across protocol versions

docs.title: Event Mask Derivation
docs.text: How the SDK computes and sends the world event mask.

docs.title: SDK State Machine
docs.text:
This document describes the behavioral state machine of the DeltaWorlds / ActiveWorlds-style SDK as derived from reverse engineering and runtime analysis.

This is a behavioral contract, not an implementation description.

docs.title: High-Level SDK State Diagram
docs.text:
State flow:

[*] -> Uninitialized

Uninitialized -> Initialized : aw_init Initialized -> Uninitialized : aw_term

Initialized -> NoConnection : init complete NoConnection -> Connected : aw_connection_set / aw_login Connected -> NoConnection : aw_exit / aw_term

Connected -> InWorld : aw_enter / aw_join InWorld -> Connected : aw_exit

InWorld -> InWorld : aw_wait InWorld -> InWorld : events and callbacks dispatched

InWorld -> InWorld : object, avatar, chat APIs InWorld -> InWorld : world attribute staging

InWorld -> WorldConfigPending : aw_world_attribute_set WorldConfigPending -> InWorld : aw_world_attributes_change

Connected -> Connected : aw_wait Connected -> Connected : limited events and callbacks

NoConnection -> NoConnection : aw_wait (no-op)

Uninitialized -> [*]

docs.title: Uninitialized
docs.text:
• SDK has not been initialized
  • All API calls fail
  • Entry state

docs.title: Initialized
docs.text:
• Thread-local SDK context allocated
  • Callback and event tables zeroed
  • No connection active

docs.title: NoConnection
docs.text:
• SDK initialized
  • No active session or instance
  • Only configuration and query calls are valid

docs.title: Connected
docs.text:
• Valid session/connection handle present
  • Not yet inside a world
  • Limited event processing available

docs.title: InWorld
docs.text:
• Client has entered a world or instance
  • Full API surface available
  • Objects, avatars, chat, camera, and world attributes are valid

docs.title: WorldConfigPending
docs.text:
• One or more world attributes staged
  • Changes not yet committed
  • Must be followed by aw_world_attributes_change

docs.title: Initialization Gate
docs.text:
All meaningful SDK calls require: - aw_init has been called - TLS initialized flag is set

Failure results in return code: - 0x1BC

docs.title: Connection Gate
docs.text:
World, object, avatar, and messaging calls require: - Active session or connection handle

Failure results in return code: - 0x1BD

docs.title: Event Pump Rule (Critical)
docs.text:
The SDK does not use background threads.

Progress only occurs when: - aw_wait is called

This includes: - Event dispatch - Callback invocation - Join and enter completion - State synchronization

Clients must call aw_wait regularly, typically once per frame.

docs.title: Callback and Event Dispatch Sub-State
docs.text:
InWorld internal flow:

Idle Idle -> Processing : aw_wait Processing -> Idle : no events Processing -> CallbackDispatch : event received CallbackDispatch -> Idle : handler returns

docs.title: Implications for Client Implementations
docs.text:
• The SDK maps directly onto a game-loop architecture
  • aw_wait should be called from the main update loop
  • No assumptions should be made about asynchronous progress
  • Permissions must be checked explicitly before mutating state
  • Observable behavior, not internal structure, defines compatibility

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
This state machine represents the minimum correct behavioral model required to build: - A compliant client - A Unity-based viewer - A bot or automation client - An API-compatible reimplementation

Any implementation that respects this model will coexist correctly with the original SDK.

docs.title: Callback Surface
docs.text: Documents all valid SdkCore_CallbackId values and when they must be registered.

docs.title: This document enumerates all valid SdkCore_EventId values accepted by the Classic SDK.
These values are validated by Enum__IsDefinedPrimitive during aw_event_set
and define the complete event surface a client may register.
Any client behavior outside this surface is rejected by the SDK runtime.
- Valid registrations update the world event mask.
- Event mask is recomputed and transmitted immediately to the server.
- Missing required events lead to incomplete world synchronization.
This list represents the full and final event surface for Classic SDK clients.
